byline.contributor: Somini Sengupta reported from the United Nations, Michael R. Gordon from New York, and Anne Barnard from Beirut, Lebanon. Neil MacFarquhar contributed reporting from Moscow, David E. Sanger from Washington, and Rick Gladstone from New York.
byline.original: By SOMINI SENGUPTA, MICHAEL R. GORDON and ANNE BARNARD

abstract: Sec of State John Kerry sharply insists on immediate grounding of all military aircraft as last hope of preserving cease-fire in Syria; explicitly challenges Russia at United Nations Security Council meeting on its role in potential war crime bombing of humanitarian aid convoy.

headline.print_headline: Kerry Urges Grounding of Military Aircraft in ‘Key Areas’ of Syria
headline.main: John Kerry Urges Grounding of Military Aircraft in ‘Key Areas’ of Syria

keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
keywords.name: subject

snippet: Mr. Kerry’s proposal Wednesday at the United Nations Security Council amounted to an 11th-hour effort to test Russian intentions in Syria....
lead_paragraph: Mr. Kerry’s proposal Wednesday at the United Nations Security Council amounted to an 11th-hour effort to test Russian intentions in Syria.
